Title: Object: Papyrus Ramesseum 19
Object: Fragment of Papyrus Ramesseum 3
Object: Fragment of Papyrus Ramesseum 4
Description: P. Ramesseum 19, Frame 1. Papyrus written on the recto and on the verso in hieratic script. The recto contains ritual/magical texts which continue on the verso. The text is written in horizontal lines. This frame contains twenty-two fragments, including a fragment of P. Ramesseum 19 (unmentioned and unpublished by Gardiner), a fragment of P. Ramesseum 3, lines A 5-8 (bottom right), a fragment of P. Ramesseum 4, lines Dv 1-2 (far right), and nineteen unidentified fragments. These fragments were first identified as part of a single papyrus and numbered 19 in 2006. This frame is labelled as 'P. Ram. Frags.'. The papyrus was probably a half-height roll. The papyrus is part of the collection of papyri found with a bundle of pens in a chest from a plundered late 13th dynasty tomb under the Ramesseum, apparently belonging to someone like a lector priest. Two of the papyri from the chest are in the Egyptian Museum Berlin (P. Ramesseum A and D); the objects are in the Fitzwilliam Museum Cambridge and the Manchester Museum. The papyri are very fragile, apparently due to dampness in the tomb-shaft. This papyrus was mounted on sheets of gelatin by Hugo Ibscher.
Curator's comments: P. Ramesseum 19 fragments of P. Ramesseum 19 (unmentioned and unpublished by Gardiner; no published transcription); P. Ramesseum 3 lines A 5-8; P. Ramesseum 4 line Dv 1, nineteen unidentified fragments. J. W. B. Barns, Five Ramesseum Papyri (Oxford: Oxford University Press 1956), pl. 10 (P. Ramesseum 3 A 5-8), pl. 20 (P. Ramesseum 4 Dv 1). B. Leach, 'A Conservation History of the Ramesseum Papyri', JEA 92 (2006), 225-40. R. B. Parkinson, Reading Ancient Egyptian Poetry: Among Other Histories (Chichester and Malden: Wiley-Blackwell 2009), 147. For fragment of P. Ramesseum 3: S. Quirke, The Administration of Egypt in the Late Middle Kingdom. The Hieratic Documents (New Malden: Sia Publishing 1990), 188-9. On the conservation of the papyri: B. Leach, 'A conservation history of the Ramesseum Papyri', JEA 92 (2006), 225-40. On the tomb: R. B. Parkinson, Reading Ancient Egyptian Poetry: Among Other Histories (Chichester and Malden: Wiley-Blackwell 2009), 138-72.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380837) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380837)
Meyrat 2019 / Les papyrus magiques du Ramesseum. Recherches sur une bibliothèque privée de la fin du Moyen Empire (175–179, 396–399)
